author: sky.cactus
content:
An ideal process in my mind would be:
1. People put forward their ideas/proposals to Core Devs to see if there is a general agreement that they are good.
2. People refine their proposals into something formal.
3. People present a formal proposal to Core Devs and get green lit for inclusion.
4. Core Devs start implementing these proposals in clients.

author: sky.cactus
content: I feel like we have told people not to do (1) or (2) for the last 6 months (and probably another month forward I would guess), and I'm concerned we are going to skip to step (4) with the selection mechanism just being somewhat degenerate, like Tim decides or something.

author: gcolvin
content:
EIP-2315
This proposal provides a complete, safe and efficient control-flow facility. It deprecates JUMP and JUMPI. It introduces two opcodes to support simple subroutines:
* RJUMPSUB destination— call a subroutine
* RETURNSUB — return from call
It depends on the two opcodes proposed by EIP-4200:
* RJUMP destination — relative jump
*RJUMPI destination — conditional relative jump

In concert with EIP-3540 and EIP-3670 it ensures that valid code will not execute invalid instructions, jump to invalid locations, or underflow stack. It will maintain consistent numbers of inputs and outputs for subroutines, and loops will not grow the stack.
